title: Scrutinizing the ‘Biden Boom’ and Its Causes
sub_head: Alan Blinder gives President Biden too much credit.
body:
Alan S. Blinder traces President Biden’s boom economy (“Welcome to Joe Biden’s Boom Economy,” op-ed, April 22) to five causes: the $2.2 trillion Cares Act in March 2020, the swiftness of Treasury and Federal Reserve monetary accommodation, the additional $900 billion in relief at the end of 2020, vaccinations and the $1.9 trillion American Relief Plan passed last month. The first two were implemented under the Trump administration with a broad consensus. The additional $900 billion relief act, which drew reasonable criticism, was enacted at the end of the Trump administration. By Mr. Blinder’s standard, the score is 3-0 Trump-Biden thus far.
The vaccination rate has increased steadily, which can be interpreted as a continuation under President Biden of a trend that commenced during the Trump administration. Given the effect of Operation Warp Speed, ignored by Mr. Blinder, the success of the vaccination rollout is at best a draw for the Biden administration. The fifth cause, the $1.9 trillion American Relief Plan, must be credited to the Biden administration, though it continues to be criticized for its effect on employment and national debt. Score: 3-1-1 in favor of the Trump administration.
One final point: Tax cuts and government spending are both types of fiscal stimulus. Mr. Blinder warned that the Trump administration’s 2017 tax cuts would cause a “sugar high,” yet now he remains silent on the potential sugar high from the incredible government spending and monetary accommodation during the last year.
Mike Lytle
Locust Valley, N.Y.
